Method new()

Create a new Cobalt object.

Usage

Cobalt$new(path = NULL, files_tbl = NULL)

Arguments

path

(character(1))
Output directory of tool. If files_tbl is supplied, this basically gets ignored.

files_tbl

(tibble(n))
Tibble of files from list_files_dir.

Method parse_gcmed()

Read gc.median.tsv file.

Usage

Cobalt$parse_gcmed(x)

Arguments

x

(character(1))
Path to file.

Method tidy_gcmed()

Usage

Cobalt$tidy_gcmed(x)

Arguments

x

(character(1))
Path to file.

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

Cobalt$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
path <- here::here(
  "nogit"
)
cob <- Cobalt$new(path)
cob$.tidy()
cob$tbls$tidy |>
  purrr::set_names(cob$tbls$parser) |>
  purrr::map(\(x) x[["data"]][[1]])
} # }
